snippet: LEAD: Two California insurance companies said today that they would set aside provisions against earnings in case they are required to return money to customers to comply with Proposition 103, a state ballot initiative that called for 20 percent i...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: Two California insurance companies said today that they would set aside provisions against earnings in case they are required to return money to customers to comply with Proposition 103, a state ballot initiative that called for 20 percent insurance rate rollbacks.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times
